note.p: Death: 26 Hyde Park Square, London (30 August 1839)
Education: Guy's Hospital, London. MD (1864), BA

Career: Lecturer in Physiology, Medical School, Guy's Hospital; Assistant Physician (1872), then Physician (1884), finally Consulting Physician (1899), Guy's Hospital; paralysed and died after a long illness
References: E M Tansey, 'George Eliot's Support for Physiology: the George Henry Lewes Trust 1879-1939' in NR 1990 vol 44 pp 221-240
